intro: Smyrnium luteum, commonly known as the yellow cow parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and feathery, aromatic leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, calcareous soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with a slender stem and umbrella-shaped inflorescences. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along riverbanks.
